entry.title: The View Between Villages
entry.summary:
Author: EarlGreyBee

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,636Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 95

Summary: Stiles left Beacon Hills. Not because he wanted to, but because he needed to learn to control his magic. In a turn of events, he disappears from the packs lives, on the run and protecting a little girl from the dangers that haunt her. Running out of sleep, patience, and new countries to hide in, Stiles returns to Beacon Hills in hopes to stop running for good. He's tired of running. He wants his life back. He wants to see his dad again. He wants to see his friends again. And this little girl deserves a better family and childhood damn it.

entry.title: The Golden Question
entry.summary:
Author: WolfFeller

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,309Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 24

Summary: A typical evening at the Hale loft takes a turn for the *hilariously* unhinged when Stiles, fueled by his insatiable curiosity (and possibly a little too much caffeine), decides to question werewolf instincts‚Äîspecifically, their *marking* habits. His innocent yet outrageous inquiry about whether werewolves feel the urge to pee on their mates sends the room into chaos.Isabelle is left breathless from laughter, Peter watches in amused satisfaction, and Scott tries (and fails) to keep things from spiraling. Meanwhile, Liam wants *no* part of it, Ruby is ready to disappear, and Allison shuts down Stiles‚Äô line of questioning with a deadpan response that only makes Isabelle laugh harder.But it‚Äôs Derek who finally puts an end to Stiles' antics‚Äîwith a dangerously smooth, *unexpectedly* dominant retort that leaves Stiles completely speechless for once in his life. As the loft settles into a mix of laughter, tension, and unspoken challenges, Stiles is left with one very important lesson: *never ask a question you‚Äôre not prepared to have answered.*

entry.title: Stiles' Superhero
entry.summary:
Author: WolfFeller

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,024Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 22

Summary: Stiles and Derek are enjoying a quiet evening walk in Beacon Hills when Stiles notices a stranger who bears an uncanny resemblance to Superman. The tall, broad-shouldered man‚Äôs confident aura strikes Stiles, and he can't help but be fascinated by the similarities between him and Derek. However, Derek‚Äôs protective instincts kick in as he senses Stiles‚Äô lingering interest, sparking a wave of possessiveness in him. Teasingly, Stiles pushes Derek's buttons, flirting with the idea of being drawn to the mysterious stranger, but Derek isn't having it. In a moment of intense jealousy and desire, Derek makes it clear that Stiles is his and always will be. Their playful banter turns into a passionate moment of reassurance, as Derek stakes his claim on Stiles in the most possessive yet loving way. Through it all, Stiles is reminded that no one‚ÄîSuperman or otherwise‚Äîcan compete with the alpha wolf who holds his heart.

entry.title: Blood Magick
entry.summary:
Author: misfitmonarchy

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,613Chapters: 1/7Kudos: 21

Summary: ‚ÄúFreeze! You--‚Äù Derek lunges and catches the wildling‚Äôs ankle. He grins, all teeth, and yanks the scrambling man so that the wildling‚Äôs body falls flat. It‚Äôs not too uncommon to find wildlings outside of cities, but they tended to wander the trade routes or at least areas with better shelter.The wildling‚Äôs arms are strong enough to fight back, and if he weren‚Äôt inhibited by his wolf‚Äôs strength, Derek presumes it would be quite a fight. As it were, he pinned the thief easily, chest down and flailing like a huffing like an animal.‚ÄúHave nothing to say, thief?‚Äù--Derek and his pack of werewolves are fur traders working their way through the winter trading route when one evening, a thief is discovered after stealing their wares. entry.title: I would never fall unless it's you I fall into
entry.summary:
Author: noninsense

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,091Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 50

Summary: Somewhere along the way, they had all become a family.Derek had always resisted the idea of a pack that wasn‚Äôt bound by blood and instinct, but it had crept up on him, settled into his bones when he wasn‚Äôt paying attention.Lydia leaving notes on his desk reminding him to eat. Scott calling just to check in. Malia forcing him into impromptu wrestling matches that ended in them both laughing, breathless and bruised. Kira always making sure the lights were on when she knew he‚Äôd be coming home late. Isaac, who still flinched sometimes but was learning to lean into the warmth of their makeshift home.¬†And Stiles‚ÄîStiles, who had managed to carve out a space for himself in Derek‚Äôs carefully guarded heart without even trying.

entry.title: A Wish Worth Granting
entry.summary:
Author: QandnoA

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 25,294Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 56

Summary: Many genies are cruel. Twisted. Bastards, even. They laugh at the misery of others. They revel in it.A few are simply neutral‚Äîneither cruel nor kind. They just heed the words of the wish-maker, grant it, and then they're gone. Sometimes the wishes are good. Sometimes the wishes turn out horrible. But they‚Äôre never around long enough to find out. Maybe that‚Äôs a gift. Maybe it‚Äôs a curse. No one can really know for sure.And then, there are the rarest ones of all. The ones that were never really meant to exist. The ones that are kind.They take the time to listen. To observe. To really take in all the events going around the wish-maker, both past and present. And what makes them the scariest of all genies‚Ä¶ They‚Äôre the only ones that can ignore.They can ignore wishes, big or small. And there are no records of their limits‚Äîhow many times they can ignore, how many wishes they can grant.The most mysterious. The most powerful. The most terrifying genies.They are known as the kindest you will ever find.- OR -The one where Stiles accidentally makes a wish to a genie and shenanigans ensue.

entry.title: Game of Pawns

Author: Mikaelsonbich25

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 17,028Chapters: 21/?Kudos: 8

Summary: The supernatural have always been around since many can remember. Some operate in the shadows while others are more public.Humans often avoid meddling in the dark side of this world, but there are some pawns that were forced into it.Two of these human pawns happen to be Steve Rogers and Peter Parker.
